intro: Boehmeria platyphylla var. marquesensis, commonly known as the Marquesan nettle, is a flowering plant native to the islands of French Polynesia. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes various species of nettles. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal forests or on rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
